author: sky.cactus
content: <@!425279588009246720> <https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/3132> is a disscussion issue for <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3135> which is stagnant.  You re-opened it as a discussions-to EIP.  I am of the opinion that we should close discussions-to issues when they are for stagnant and withdrawn EIPs.  Do you hold a different view on this?

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, why did you re-open this?  <https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3696>

author: sky.cactus
content: Looks like you did this in a few places, which implies it is either intentional or you just re-opened a bunch of issues in some kind of automated way and they are all on accident.

author: axic3354
content:
I took this as an indication from the author to keep it alive: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3696#issuecomment-941089258

It is something which should be merged anyway.

author: axic3354
content: I think all issues which are discussion URLs should be kept open. We can have another bot step which closes them if the EIP in question is withdrawn/archived, but not sure about stagnant.

author: axic3354
content: I guess all this goes back to the fact that I am not unsure about stagnant stage in general, I still think it should be just "withdrawn" with the "withdrawal-reason: inactivity" and allow withdrawn EIPs to be resurrected.

author: ansgar.eth
content: <@!301186049323958275> looks like someone vandalized EIP-4444 and snuck in this clearly unprofessional section: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4444#confusion-with-other-proposals

author: axic3354
content: this is what 3+ hour long party chats result in

author: gcolvin
content: Withdrawn should mean that the author withdrew it, not a bot.  Otherwise it's misleading.  E.g. EIP615 recently went Stagnant.  I don't intend to withdraw it until other EIPs have done the job it set out to do, and I don't want people to think that I have done so.
